TestCase.name: star (11)
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to use the star element both with and without the index attribute.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #11.
Test passed 1.
Test passed 2.

TestCase.name: star * (11a)
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to return the values captured by indexed * (asterisk) wildcards.
TestCase.Input: teststar Test passed one and Test passed two and Test passed three and Test passed four
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #11a.
star index 1: Test passed one.
star index 2: Test passed two.
star index 3: Test passed three.
star index 4: Test passed four.

TestCase.name: star _ (11b)
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to return the values captured by indexed _ (underscore) wildcards.
TestCase.Input: testunderscore Test passed one and Test passed two and Test passed three and Test passed four
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #11b.
star index 1: Test passed one.
star index 2: Test passed two.
star index 3: Test passed three.
star index 4: Test passed four.

TestCase.name: random (12)
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to use the random function.

TestCase.name: word format (13)
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to adjust the word case based on the four format elements: uppercase, lowercase, sentence, and formal.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #13.
Test passed if UPPERCASE.
Test passed if lowercase.
Test passed if Proper Name.
Test passed if This is a sentence.

TestCase.name: nested word format (14)
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to use nested word format elements.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #14.
Test passed if THIS IS UPPER CASE, and this is a Proper Name.

TestCase.name: simple multisentence that (15)
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to properly set the bot's last response into the proper THAT value holders. It issues a multi sentence response, which should result in the bot's setting the THAT stack to each sentence.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer: Test case #15 setup. THAT plus two. THAT plus one. THAT.

TestCase.name: that (15)
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #15.
THAT: Old form: THAT.
New form: THAT.
THAT+1: THAT plus one.
THAT+2: THAT plus two.

TestCase.name: multisentence that array (16) setup a
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to properly set the bot's last response into the proper THAT value holders. It specifically tests a 3X4 deep array of the last four bot responses. It has a setup phase, and a test phase.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #16 setup a.
THAT array4 response three.
THAT array4 response two.
THAT array4 response one.

TestCase.name: multisentence that array (16) setup b
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #16 setup b.
THAT array3 response three.
THAT array3 response two.
THAT array3 response one.

TestCase.name: multisentence that array (16) setup c
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #16 setup c.
THAT array2 response three.
THAT array2 response two.
THAT array2 response one.

TestCase.name: multisentence that array (16) setup d
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #16 setup d.
THAT array1 response three.
THAT array1 response two.
THAT array1 response one.

TestCase.name: multisentence that array (16)
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #16.
Array 1
THAT: THAT array1 response one.
THAT+1: THAT array1 response two.
THAT+2: THAT array1 response three.
Array 2
THAT: THAT array2 response one.
THAT+1: THAT array2 response two.
THAT+2: THAT array2 response three.
Array 3
THAT: THAT array3 response one.
THAT+1: THAT array3 response two.
THAT+2: THAT array3 response three.
Array 4
THAT: THAT array4 response one.
THAT+1: THAT array4 response two.
THAT+2: THAT array4 response three.

TestCase.name: return name when set (40)
TestCase.Description: Tests the ability to return the name of a return-name-when-set predicate when it is set, and to return the value when a non-return-name-when-set predicate is set. It depends on the proper definition of the "passed" and "failed" predicates in predicates.xml.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #40.
Test passed 1.
Test passed 2.

TestCase.name: infinite loop (41)
TestCase.Description: ests the ability to detect a simple kind of infinite loop, and avoid it by substituting the phrase "INFINITE LOOP" (or whatever is configured).
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #41.
Test passed.

TestCase.Description: Probably redundant - just verifies that set elements can contain other elements.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #42.
Test passed.

TestCase.name: mixed content in set (43)
TestCase.Description: Also probably redundant - just verifies that set elements can contain mixed content.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:

TestCase.name: elements in block condition (45) setup
TestCase.Description: Verifies that AIML elements within a block condition are properly processed.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer: Test case #45 setup okay.

TestCase.name: elements in block condition (45)
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer: Test passed if this sentence was capitalized.

TestCase.name: retention of star values during srai (46)
TestCase.Description: Verifies that values assigned to star elements from pattern matching are retained after a srai (i.e., that the srai does not improperly cause the reassignment of a new value to the star, based on the srai'ed pattern match.
TestCase.ExpectedAnswer:
Test case #46.
Test passed.
